terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Wyoming mountains. Moderate elevation with mountain scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional WY event. Mountain terrain with remote location, high altitude, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: The Mane Event Gravel is a regional event in Wyoming‚Äîmountain terrain with moderate elevation and high altitude. The Wyoming mountains are scenic, but the small local field, remote location, and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional WY mountain gravel race. Worth it for WY/Mountain West riders. Not worth traveling far for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to WY‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're traveling‚Äîskip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better WY races: Dead Swede Gravel, WYO 131, Cowboy Crusher.

logistics.food: Sheridan has full dining options. Stock nutrition.
logistics.official_site: Check The Mane Event Gravel website

course_description.signature_challenge: Wyoming mountains terrain at high altitude.

non_negotiables.why: Wyoming mountains require sustained mountain effort.
Limited aid stations and remote location require self-sufficiency.

marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional event with mountain terrain and high altitude.

logistics.explanation: Start/finish at Koltiska Pumpkin Patch with rider check-in Friday 4-8pm plus race day registration for late arrivals. Staggered starts manage distance groups from 7:30am (78-mile) to 9:30am (25-mile). Flagged parking and dry camping available but lodging strategy unclear.

length.explanation: 54-mile option at 3,188 feet of climbing hits that awkward middle distance between recreational and serious gravel racing. Four distance options from 25 to 78 miles with staggered wave starts every 30-60 minutes help manage field spread and pacing groups. More compact than Grinduro.

technicality.explanation: Jim Rapp describes routes that "take riders onto scenic roadways and rolling hills" through ranch land and sweeping foothills. Course features moderate terrain with "rolling short steep hills or moderate, sustained climbs" on well-maintained county roads without technical drama. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds.

elevation.explanation: The 54-mile climbs 3,188 feet with "a long draw of a climb" mid-race followed by "a long downhill in the last ~15 miles." Rolling ranch country delivers challenging but manageable Wyoming elevation through foothills terrain east of Sheridan. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: 2025 race delivered "wonderful weather" with 52¬∞F at 7:30am start warming to 80¬∞F high and light winds. Rain hit days before but cleared for race day. September in Wyoming can be perfect or harsh ‚Äî this year riders got lucky. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Starting from Sheridan's base elevation around 3,800 feet through rolling ranch country that keeps maximum elevations reasonable. You'll notice it coming from sea level but won't need serious acclimatization for Wyoming foothills terrain. Modest altitude compared to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

adventure.explanation: Routes showcase "the untamed beauty of Wyoming" winding through rolling ranch land and sweeping foothills on mostly gravel county roads. Well-marked courses with aid stations every 12-15 miles provide backcountry Wyoming experience with proper support.

prestige.explanation: Gale Vanderpool enjoys "the family-like setting of the race and competitors at the starting point." This charity fundraiser for Sheridan Sundowners Lions Club vision programs draws local community support rather than gravel scene recognition.

race_quality.explanation: Well-marked routes with aid stations every 12-15 miles providing water, electrolytes, and snacks plus sweeper vehicle support. Event features "spirited camaraderie" with organized packet pickup, staggered starts, and finishing medals for all distances.

experience.explanation: Cody Mefford notes the venue provides "a location for families to have fun while their racers challenge themselves" with music and post-race meal. SWAG bags include t-shirt and nutrition products with finishing medals creating pleasant family atmosphere.

community.explanation: Event showcases "spirited camaraderie" and "welcoming community vibe" as the primary fundraiser for Lions Club vision programs. Gale Vanderpool highlights the "family-like setting" while supporting causes like international SightFirst Program to eradicate blindness.

field_depth.explanation: Four distance options with staggered wave starts from 7:30am to 9:30am manage different pace groups. 25-mile results show recreational pace spreads with weekend warrior field averaging 9-16 mph rather than competitive depth. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Entry fees range $70-110 including SWAG bag, post-race meal, t-shirt, finishing medals, and aid station nutrition across 6 support stations. The charity fundraising angle adds purpose beyond riding while keeping pricing reasonable for supported gravel event.

expenses.explanation: Free dry camping available at venue with advance notice ‚Äî pack in and pack out your gear. Entry fees $70-110 depending on distance with post-race meal included. Sheridan location keeps lodging costs manageable compared to destination gravel events. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: IRC Boken Double Cross
primary.why: Underrated mixed-terrain tire. Fast center with confident shoulder grip.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: The Mane Event Gravel gravel race Sheridan

videos.title: 'The Lollapalooza of Gravel': What brings riders (back) to The Mid South
videos.description:
From racers to party pacers, and confident fixie riders to nervous first timers, The Mid South is a big-tent gravel event in Stillwater, Oklahoma. The weekend has everything from 12-mile riders to the main 100-mile race and also many running events, from a half marathon to a 50K Ultra. The truly bold can do both: The Double is the 50K run Friday and the 100mi bike Saturday.

Things kicked off Thursday night with the Denim ride, which I what I captured here. 

Also, I lost a DJI (GoPro-looking camera) out on the road. Doh! If anybody finds an Action Cam 5, holler! 

Want to see what I'm testing and where? Follow me
on Strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/ben-delaney
or on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ben_delaney

--
The Ride is supported in 2025 by:
Castelli clothing: http://tinyurl.com/43k6pftp
Perc coffee: https://tinyurl.com/fjr7nurr (save 15% with code 'ride15')
Saris racks: https://saris.com/collections/racks# (save 15% with code 'ben15')
Silca maintenance: https://bit.ly/47xxvzj (save 10% with code 'theridewithben10')
BikeTiresDirect: https://tinyurl.com/yc7vxujh (save 10% with code 'THERIDE') 
The Cyclist Lawyer: https://www.thecyclist-lawyer.com/
Shimano shoes & glasses: http://tinyurl.com/ye274tep
Feedback Sports stands & tools: https://bit.ly/3S9Dq8r

Albuquerque New Mexico what keeps me
coming back to the Midsouth is this
feeling of the bike Church Revival
Midsouth was the first gravel race I did
back in 2016 and I immediately flipped
the switch from being gravel skeptic to
gravel evangelist if you want to race
there's certainly no shortage of fast
kids at the front to give you a run for
your money you want to take it easy and
roll on a fat bike tandem with a whiskey
flask on your down tube you'll have
company there and then there'll be all
the rest of us in between this is just a
little taste of what's coming up this
weekend I'm testing this parley to may
put on some shallower Wheels because the
forecast is calling for some Highland
wind thanks for watching let me know
what questions you have and hope to see
you here in still waterer Oklahoma for a
future mids
South hey
hey hey how are you yo yo

videos.title: USA Gravel Nationals 2025 | RAW HIGHLIGHTS
videos.description:
Here we are in La Crescent, MN, just 2 hours away from my home town of Mankato, MN, for the 2025 USA Cycling gravel Nationals. With this being so close to home and on terrain with short to medium punchy climbs that suits my riding style so well, It's safe to say this was the race I was most excited for all season.

SPOILER ALERT HERE: Everything was going perfect to plan, right on Pete and Alexey up the first 4 climbs, and even off the front for a small bit after climb number 4. Then, disaster. I dropped a bottle in Aid 2 and thought I could stop to grab it, but the bottle had exploded. The 7 seconds of stopping time I had here to get another one was Amplified by the fact that it was on a DH and the defending champ was attacking through it, and by the time I got going again it was too late.

So much "would have, could have, should have" with this one, but I will take from this knowlege to learn and grow, as we can often find more growth in our failures than in our successes.

videos.title: My First Gravel Race | Gravel One Fifty
videos.description:
Welcome to the first episode of the thrilling UCI gravel series! Join a passionate novice cyclist as he takes on his first-ever UCI gravel race, the Gravel One Fifty, in the Netherlands. From a challenging start at the back to pushing for ambitious goals, witness the highs and lows of this adrenaline-fueled adventure.

Explore stunning farmlands and experience the camaraderie among riders as they navigate tough terrains and unexpected turns. Witness strategic alliances and daring moves to close gaps, all while chasing the dream of qualifying for the UCI Gravel World Championships.

But, just when victory seems within reach, a dramatic move in the final stretch adds a twist to the tale. Embrace the spirit of resilience as our rider continues to ride on, showcasing the essence of the gravel racing community.

Whether you're a seasoned gravel racer or a cycling enthusiast seeking excitement, this video delivers unforgettable moments and surprises from the world of gravel races. Subscribe now for more exhilarating episodes to come!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
As I don't have any sponsors yet, I would like to dedicate this video to a buddy of mine who is running from Amsterdam to Kyiv at the moment. In 50 days he will run 2500 K's in order to raise money and build Ambulances for Ukraine. Your support at ultra4ukraine.com would mean the world to us.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Feel free to follow me on Strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/flyinggravelman
Contact: HesTech.FGM@gmail.com

Video chapters
0:00 Intro
1:09 Start of race
6:52 Closing the gaps
23:00 Farm
23:47 Exciting Finale
26:30 Crash
28:29 Stats + Outro

videos.title: (SOLD) Benny - Cowgirl Cadillacs 2025 (Sheridan, WY)
videos.description:
Benny is proudly consigned to the 2025 Cowgirl Cadillacs horse sale in Sheridan, Wyoming. 

Benny
2018 Pinto x Draft Gelding

Benny was born and raised in Canada‚Äôs ranching and farming heartland. He had excellent upbringing and training which exposed him to many experiences and resulted in a very well rounded horse. He is an irreplaceable partner for all the ranch tasks - moving cattle, sorting, doctoring, branding, shooting varmints, you name it. He is a gentleman on the job - no spook, no worries, no fuss. Through mud bogs and down gravel roads, on cattle drives, and trips to the mountains, benny is sure footed, steady, and confident. He‚Äôs not bothered by traffic or machinery and can safely be ridden in those circumstances that can make many other horses uncomfortable. He stays broke no matter how often you ride and he is there when you need him, whether it‚Äôs a ride for pleasure or a full day of work on the ranch. He is safe, responsive and very well broke. He is perfect to ride out alone or with others and is also harness broke to drive single! 

Benny has a solid foundation in the arena. He stops, spins, changes leads, and understands leg aids well. He‚Äôs happy to do arena work and is very handy on a cow. He is light to the aids and could easily be enjoyed in events like team sorting, penning, gymkhana, working equitation, or cowboy challenge.

Benny‚Äôs gentle, unflappable disposition also makes him the mount of choice when it comes time to teach the next generation to ride. He happily wears english tack and jumps around the ring, tolerating the young rider‚Äôs mistakes and helping them gain confidence in the saddle. He can be ridden bareback, backwards, double, in a halter, or with a neck rope. He is a perfect mount for a young rider to grow up with, whether they wants to ride for ribbons or ride for adventures on the ranch. He is affectionate but has good manners and is gentle with little ones.  

Having had Benny in my program, I truly feel proud to be offering him at Cowgirl Cadillacs. He is a phenomenal little horse, one of my favourites, and will be greatly missed. Though I know he will make someone very happy and will be the best partner for many years to come.
